name: "Wii Sports" Fun Online Quiz | Wii Sports | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many different activities can you play in the game?
questions.explanation:
Twenty-one.

	The sports are Tennis, Baseball, Bowling, Golf, and Boxing. There are some training activities, as well as Wii Fitness.

questions.text: How many training exercises can be found in the game?
questions.explanation:
Fifteen.

	There are three exercises per sport. The training exercises vary for each sport, but some have the same concept.

questions.text: How many modes are there in golf?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	You can play all nine holes, or you can play them in chunks of three. The first three are easy, the middle three are medium, and the final three are in the hard category.

questions.text: What is the lowest Wii Fitness Level you can get?
questions.explanation:
20.

	20 is the best score you can get. You play three training exercises each time you play.

questions.text: What is the highest score you can get in Wii Fitness?
questions.explanation:
80.

	80 is the worst score you can get in this section of the game. You can only play this mode once per day for each Mii.

questions.text: How many experience points do you have to get in order to get to Pro status?
questions.explanation:
1,000.

	The score is the same for all sports. You get some extra bonuses for reaching Pro status. You can lose Pro status if you go back under 1,000 points.

questions.text: What is the highest medal you can get in training?
questions.explanation:
Platinum.

	The medals are hard to get, especially gold and platinum. The higher your score, the more likely you are to get a good medal.

questions.text: Up to how many people can play Bowling, Golf, and Tennis?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	You should have one Wii Remote per player. In Bowling and Golf, you can share a Wii Remote, but you need a Wii Remote for each player otherwise.

questions.text: Up to how many people can play Baseball and Boxing?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	You need one Remote per player. Unlike Bowling and Golf, you need to have a Wii Remote for each player.

Boxing.

	You also need it for the training exercises for this sport, too. Boxing is the only sport that requires this accessory.
